tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"walk away from its owner"
This is an idiom. AT: "act as if you do not see them" or "go away without doing anything" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: If your fellow Israelite is not near to you
tn.text: "If your fellow Israelite lives far away from you"

tn.ref: or if you do not know him
tn.text: "or if you do not know who the owner of the animal is"

tn.ref: and it must be with you until he looks for it
tn.text: "and you must keep the animal with you until its owner comes looking for it"
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: You must do the same with his donkey
tn.text: "You must return his donkey in the same way"

tn.ref: you must do the same with his garment
tn.text: "you must return his clothing in the same way"
This is an idiom. AT: "you must not act as if you do not see that he has lost something" or "you must not go away without doing anything" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: you must surely help him to lift it up again
tn.text: "you must help your fellow Israelite lift the animal back up onto its feet"
Moses is still speaking to the people of Israel.
"men's clothing"
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
a home that birds make for themselves out of sticks, grass, plants, and mud

tn.ref: with young ones or eggs in it
tn.text: "with baby birds or eggs in the nest"

tn.ref: and the mother sitting on the young
tn.text: "and the mother bird is sitting on the baby birds"
Long days are a metaphor for a long life. AT: "be able to live a long time." Translate these words as they are in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:25|4:26]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
a low fence around the edge of the roof so people will not fall off the roof

tn.ref: so that you do not bring blood on your house
tn.text: Blood is a symbol for death. AT: "so that it will not be the fault of your household if someone dies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"if anyone falls from the roof because you did not make a railing"
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: so that the whole harvest is not confiscated by the holy place
tn.text: The words "holy place" is a metonym for the priests who work in the holy place. This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that the priests in Yahweh's holy place do not take away the whole harvest" or "so that you do not defile the whole harvest and the priests do not allow you to use it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: and the yield of the vineyard
tn.text: "and the fruit that grows in the vineyard"
soft, curly hair that grows on a sheep
thread made from the flax plant (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the word "you" here is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"tassels" (UDB). These are threads that are bound together and hang from the end of each corner of the cloak.
a long garment that a person wears over his other clothes
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: and then accuses her of shameful things
tn.text: "and then accuses her of having slept with someone before she was married"

tn.ref: and puts a bad reputation on her
tn.text: The abstract noun "reputation" can be translated as a verb phrase. AT: "and makes other people think she is a bad person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: but when I came near to her
tn.text: This is a polite way of saying "to have sexual relations with someone." AT: "but when I slept with her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: I found no proof of virginity in her
tn.text: The abstract noun "proof" can be translated as a verb phrase. AT: "she could not prove to me that she was a virgin"
Moses is still speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: must take proof of her virginity
tn.text: The abstract noun "proof" can be translated as a verb phrase. AT: "must take something that proves that she was a virgin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
Moses is still speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: he has accused her of shameful things
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "he has accused her of having slept with someone before he married her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: I did not find in your daughter the proof of virginity
tn.text: The abstract nouns "proof" and "virginity" can be translated as verb phrases. AT: "Your daughter could not prove that she was a virgin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: But here is the proof of my daughter's virginity
tn.text: The abstract nouns "proof" and "virginity" can be translated as verb phrases. AT: "But this proves that my daughter was a virgin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: Then they will spread the garment out before the elders of the city
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "And then the mother and father will show the clothing with the bloodstain to the elders as proof that she was a virgin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.
"and they must make him pay as a punishment"
"100 shekels" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: and give them to the father of the girl
tn.text: "and give the money to the father of the girl"

tn.ref: has caused a bad reputation for a virgin of Israel
tn.text: The abstract noun "reputation" can be translated as a verb phrase. AT: "has caused people to think that a virgin of Israel is a bad person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: he may not send her away
tn.text: "never allow him to divorce her"
This is an idiom. AT: "for his entire life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: But if this thing is true
tn.text: "But if it is true" or "But if what the man said is true"

tn.ref: that the proof of virginity was not found in the girl
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that the man did not find proof that the girl was a virgin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The abstract nouns "proof" and "virginity" can be translated as verb phrases. AT: "something that proves that the girl was a virgin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: then they must bring out the girl
tn.text: "then the elders must bring out the girl"

tn.ref: stone her to death with stones
tn.text: "throw stones at her until she dies"

tn.ref: because she has committed a disgraceful action in Israel
tn.text: "because she has done a disgraceful thing in Israel"

tn.ref: to act as a harlot in her father's house
tn.text: "acting like a harlot while living in her father's house"

The adjective "evil" can be translated as a noun phrase. AT: "you must remove from among the Israelites the person who does this evil thing" or "you must execute this evil person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the word "you" is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "If someone finds a man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"in this way you will remove" (see UDB)
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the word "you" is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"who is promised to marry a man"
These commands are addressed to Israel as a group and so are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"then you must bring both the girl and the man who slept with her"

tn.ref: because she did not cry out
tn.text: "because she did not call for help"

tn.ref: because he violated his neighbor's wife
tn.text: The Israelites at that time thought of a man and woman who had engaged each other for marriage as husband and wife. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "because he slept with a girl who belongs to a fellow Israelite" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: and you will remove the evil from among you
tn.text: The adjective "evil" can be translated as a noun phrase. AT: "you must remove from among the Israelites the person who does this evil thing" or "you must execute this evil person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This means a girl whose parents have agreed to let her marry a certain man, but the girl has not married him yet.

tn.ref: then only the man who sleeps with her must die
tn.text: "then you must only kill the man who slept with her"

tn.ref: there is no sin worthy of death in the girl
tn.text: "you are not to punish her by killing her for what she did"

tn.ref: For this case is like when a man attacks his neighbor and kills him
tn.text: "Because this situation is like the situation when somebody attacks another person and kills him"

tn.ref: For he found her in the field
tn.text: "Because the man found the girl working in the field"
"but whose parents have not promised another man that she will marry him"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "and if somebody finds out what happened" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
A shekel weighs eleven grams. AT: "fifty pieces of silver" or "550 grams of silver" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: He may not send her away during all his days
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "He must never divorce her during his entire life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: must not take his father's wife as his own
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "must not marry his father's former wife, even if she is not his mother" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
